title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1154.1 - Permission conditioned upon compliance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1154.1 - Permission conditioned upon compliance

State Regulations

Any permission granted by the authority directly or
indirectly, expressly or by implication, to any person or persons, to enter
upon or use any terminal or any part thereof (including operators, crew members
and passengers, spectators, sightseers, pleasure and commercial vehicles, officers and employees, lessees and other persons occupying space at such
terminal, persons doing business with the authority, its lessees, sub-lessees
and permittees, and all other persons whatsoever, whether or not of the type
indicated), is conditioned upon compliance with the authority rules and
regulations; and entry upon or into any terminal by any person shall be deemed
to constitute an agreement by such person to comply with said rules and
regulations; provided, however, that provision may be made in a written lease
that said rules and regulations shall not apply to such leased
area. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1154.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
